p: Moderate in vitro antiplasmodial activity (IC 50 values of 11-50 μg/ml) was observed for all the extracts of Z. chalybeum leaves in this study. However, previous studies reported high in vitro antiplasmodial activity was reported for the leaves collected in Uganda [ 30]. The discrepancy is attributable to various factors such as geographical location, season, time of harvest, plant part used, and age of the plant among others [ 28].
